Class Statistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • Statistics

  • public class Statistics
extends java.lang.Object
    Statistics Class Contains methods to calculate statistics related to security transactions over time. Also includes methods to split securities into sectors based on the correlation of their prices over time.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Statistics()

      static double[] getPriceStats(java.lang.String symbol, Date start, Date end)
      Computes the highest price, lowest price, mean price, median price, and volatility given start and end times
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Company>> makeSects()
      Classify securities into sectors
      static double predictPrice(java.lang.String symbol, Date start, Date end, Date predict)
      Generates a regression line from the start and end dates and predicts a price based on the regression model #NOTE: The TRAINING DATA given demonstrates ticks on a millsecond basis Predictions are recommended to be consistent with the training data.
      static double priceMovement(java.lang.String symbol, Date start, Date end)
      Computes the price movement of a security given start and end times

      • predictPrice

        public static double predictPrice(java.lang.String symbol,
                                  Date start,
                                  Date end,
                                  Date predict)
        Generates a regression line from the start and end dates and predicts a price based on the regression model #NOTE: The TRAINING DATA given demonstrates ticks on a millsecond basis Predictions are recommended to be consistent with the training data.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the unique ticker identifier
        start - the starting timestamp
        end - the ending timestamp
        predict - the date of the price to predict
        Returns:
        the predicted price given date
